info.title: Maps API
info.description:
The mapping API is a [web map tile service](https://www.ogc.org/standard/wmts/) making it straightforward to visualize GBIF content on interactive maps, and overlay content from other sources. ## Feature overview

Birds (Aves) in Australia.
The following features are supported: * Map layers are available for a **country**, **dataset**, **taxon** (including species, subspecies or higher taxa), **publisher**, **publishing country** or **network**. These layers can be filtered by year range, basis of record and country. * Data is returned as points, or “binned” into hexagons or squares. * Four map projections are supported. * Tiles are available in vector format for client styling, or raster format with predefined styles. * Arbitrary search terms are also supported, though binning is required for these searches. This service is intended for use with commonly used clients such as the [OpenLayers](https://openlayers.org/) or [Leaflet](https://leafletjs.com/) Javascript libraries, [Google Maps](https://developers.google.com/maps/), or some GIS software including [QGIS](https://www.qgis.org/). These libraries allow the GBIF layers to be visualized with other content, such as those coming from [web map service (WMS)](https://www.ogc.org/standard/wms/) providers. It should be noted that the mapping API is not a WMS service, nor does it support WFS capabilities. ## Tile formats Two tile formats are available: **vector tiles** and **raster tiles**. The raster tiles are generated from the vector tiles. A modern web browser can show either format. The styling of vector tiles is determined by client-side configuration (e.g. Javascript); raster tiles are styled according to a limited set of GBIF styles. *Point* vector tiles are usually larger than an equivalent raster tile and can often be slow to render. Simple vector tiles (few points, or any number of squares or hexagons) are small, fast to render, and can make zooming in and out smoother. Vector tiles use [Mapbox Vector Tile format](https://www.mapbox.com/vector-tiles/), and contain a single layer `occurrence`. Objects in that layer are either points (default) or polygons (if chosen). Each object has a `total` value; that is the number of occurrences at that point or in the polygon. Raster tiles are provided in PNG format, and are normally 512px wide squares. ## Map styling Vector tiles must by styled by the client. Raster styles are predefined, and chosen with the `style=` parameter. All available styles are shown below. Note the styles labelled “approimate” are not intended for precise analysis.
Style Record count
1–10 11–100 101–1000 1001–10000 10001–100000 100001+
Classic
classic.point

classic.poly

classic-noborder.poly
Purple-yellow
purpleYellow.point

purpleYellow.poly

purpleYellow-noborder.poly
Green
green.point

green.poly

green-noborder.poly
Heat
purpleHeat.point		 Approximate

blueHeat.point		 Approximate

orangeHeat.point		 Approximate

greenHeat.point		 Approximate
Fire
fire.point		 Approximate
Glacier
glacier.point		 Approximate
Green 2
green2.poly

green2-noborder.poly
iNaturalist
iNaturalist.poly
Purple-white
purpleWhite.poly
Red
red.poly
Marker
blue.marker

orange.marker

outline.poly
Geo-centroid
scaled.circles
## Example queries | Description | Sample | Live demo | |-------------|--------|-----------| | All occurrences — no additional parameters
`https://api.gbif.org/v2/map/occurrence/density/{z}/{x}/{y}@1x.png?style=green.point` | | | All birds (*Aves*) by small hexagons, EPSG:4326 projection
`https://api.gbif.org/v2/map/occurrence/density/{z}/{x}/{y}@1x.png?srs=EPSG:4326&taxonKey=212&bin=hex&hexPerTile=117&style=green-noborder.poly` | | | All birds observed by machine between 2015 and 2017 as squares, EPSG:4326 projection
`https://api.gbif.org/v2/map/occurrence/density/{z}/{x}/{y}@1x.png?srs=EPSG:4326&taxonKey=212&basisOfRecord=MACHINE_OBSERVATION&years=2015,2017&bin=square&squareSize=128&style=purpleYellow-noborder.poly` | | | All occurrences from 2000 onwards published by American publishers
`https://api.gbif.org/v2/map/occurrence/density/{z}/{x}/{y}@1x.png?publishingCountry=US&year=2000,2030&style=fire.point` | | | *Fulmarus glacialis* (northern fulmar) observations, in Arctic projection
`https://api.gbif.org/v2/map/occurrence/density/{z}/{x}/{y}@1x.png?srs=EPSG:3575&taxonKey=2481433&basisOfRecord=HUMAN_OBSERVATION&basisOfRecord=MACHINE_OBSERVATION&style=classic.point` | | | Ad-hoc query for fungi with images, and without detected geospatial issues
`https://api.gbif.org/v2/map/occurrence/adhoc/{z}/{x}/{y}@1x.png?srs=EPSG:4326&mode=GEO_CENTROID&taxonKey=6&hasGeospatialIssue=false&mediaType=StillImage&style=scaled.circles` | | See also [further examples and demos](https://api.gbif.org/v2/map/demo.html), and an example using [CodePen](https://codepen.io/hofft/pen/GRROjmo) ## Projections The projection defines how coordinates on Earth are transformed to a two-dimensional surface. The tile schema defines how that two dimensional surface is split into smaller square images, and how those images are addressed. Up to four projections are available, depending on the endpoint. Information on the projections is available on the [GBIF base map tiles](https://tile.gbif.org/ui/) page. ## Base map tiles Base map tiles showing land and oceans, forests, roads and so on are available at [tile.gbif.org](https://tile.gbif.org/) for users of this API. ## Further resources * [Base map examples](https://tile.gbif.org/ui/) * [Raster style demos](https://api.gbif.org/v2/map/demo.html) * [OpenLayers-based toolbox](https://api.gbif.org/v2/map/debug/ol/)

tags.name: Occurrence maps
tags.description: This API provides pre-calculated and ad-hoc occurrence map tiles.

get.description:
Retrieves a tile showing occurrence locations in [Mapbox Vector Tile format](https://www.mapbox.com/vector-tiles/)

Tiles contain a single layer `occurrence`. Features in that layer are either points (default) or polygons (if chosen). Each feature has a `total` value; that is the number of occurrences at that point or in the polygon.

**One primary search parameter is permitted**, from these: `taxonKey`, `datasetKey`, `country`, `networkKey`, `publishingOrg`, `publishingCountry`.

This can be combined with the parameter `country`, this limits the primary search to occurrences in that country.

parameters.name: z
parameters.description: Zoom level

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: Tile map column. 0 is the leftmost column, at the rightmost column `x == 2ᶻ – 1`, except for EPSG:4326 projection where `x == 2ᶻ⁺¹ – 1`

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Tile map row. 0 is the top row, for the bottom row `y == 2ᶻ – 1`.

parameters.name: srs
parameters.description:
Map projection. One of
* `EPSG:3857` (Web Mercator)
* `EPSG:4326` (WGS84 plate careé)
* `EPSG:3575` (Arctic LAEA)
* `EPSG:3031` (Antarctic stereographic)
See [Projections](#projections)

parameters.name: basisOfRecord
parameters.description:
Basis of record, as defined in our BasisOfRecord vocabulary.

The parameter may be repeated to retrieve occurrences with any of the chosen bases of record.

items.description:
The values of the Darwin Core term Basis of Record which can apply to occurrences.

See GBIF's [Darwin Core Type Vocabulary](https://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/dwc/basis_of_record.xml) for definitions.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

parameters.name: year
parameters.description:
The 4 digit year or year range. A year of 98 will be interpreted as 98 AD.

Ranges are written as `1990,2000`, `1990,` or `,1900`.

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description: If set, counts will be grouped by year to allow a fast view of different years. If unset (the default), the total will be a count for all years.

parameters.name: bin
parameters.description: Binning style.  `hex` will aggregate points into a hexagonal grid (see `hexPerTile`). `square` will aggregate into a square grid (see `squareSize`).

parameters.name: hexPerTile
parameters.description: With `bin=hex`, sets the number of hexagons horizontally across a tile.

parameters.name: squareSize
parameters.description: With `bin=square`, sets the size of the squares in pixels on a 4096px tile.  Choose a factor of 4096 so they tessalete correctly.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description:
Map tile format and resolution.
* `.mvt` for a vector tile
* `@Hx.png` for a 256px raster tile (for legacy clients)
* `@1x.png` for a 512px raster tile
* `@2x.png` for a 1024px raster tile
* `@3x.png` for a 2048px raster tile
* `@4x.png` for a 4096px raster tile
The larger raster tiles are intended for high resolution displays, i.e. 4k monitors and many mobile phones.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description:
Raster map style — only applies to raster (PNG) tiles.

Choose from one of the available styles, the default is `classic.point`.

Styles ending with `.point` should only be used by non-binned tiles.  Styles ending with `.poly` or `.marker.` should be used with hexagonal- or square-binned tiles.

See [map styles](#section/Map-styling).

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The 2-letter country code (as per ISO-3166-1) of the country in which the occurrence was recorded.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

parameters.name: taxonKey
parameters.description: A taxon key from the GBIF backbone.

parameters.name: datasetKey
parameters.description: The occurrence dataset key (a UUID).

parameters.name: publishingOrg
parameters.description: The publishing organization's GBIF key (a UUID).

parameters.name: publishingCountry
parameters.description: The 2-letter country code (as per ISO-3166-1) of the owning organization's country.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

parameters.name: networkKey
parameters.description: The network's GBIF key (a UUID).

get.summary: Summary of a density tile map query
get.description:
A summary of the data available for a [density tile](#operation/getDensityTile) query.

It accepts the same search parameters as the density tile query.

parameters.name: basisOfRecord
parameters.description:
Basis of record, as defined in our BasisOfRecord vocabulary.

The parameter may be repeated to retrieve occurrences with any of the chosen bases of record.

items.description:
The values of the Darwin Core term Basis of Record which can apply to occurrences.

See GBIF's [Darwin Core Type Vocabulary](https://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/dwc/basis_of_record.xml) for definitions.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

parameters.name: networkKey

parameters.name: year
parameters.description:
The 4 digit year or year range. A year of 98 will be interpreted as 98 AD.

Ranges are written as `1990,2000`, `1990,` or `,1900`.

get.description:
Retrieves a tile showing occurrence locations in [Mapbox Vector Tile format](https://www.mapbox.com/vector-tiles/)

Tiles contain a single layer `occurrence`. Features in that layer are either points (default) or polygons (if chosen). Each feature has a `total` value; that is the number of occurrences at that point or in the polygon.

Any search parameter allowed by the [occurrence search](/en/openapi/v1/occurrence#tag/Searching-occurrences/operation/searchOccurrence) is supported.

parameters.name: z
parameters.description: Zoom level

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: Tile map column. 0 is the leftmost column, at the rightmost column `x == 2ᶻ – 1`, except for EPSG:4326 projection where `x == 2ᶻ⁺¹ – 1`

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Tile map row. 0 is the top row, for the bottom row `y == 2ᶻ – 1`.

parameters.name: srs
parameters.description:
Map projection. One of
* `EPSG:3857` (Web Mercator)
* `EPSG:4326` (WGS84 plate careé)
* `EPSG:3575` (Arctic LAEA)
* `EPSG:3031` (Antarctic stereographic)
See [Projections](#projections)

parameters.name: bin
parameters.description: Binning style.  `hex` will aggregate points into a hexagonal grid (see `hexPerTile`). `square` will aggregate into a square grid (see `squareSize`).

parameters.name: hexPerTile
parameters.description: With `bin=hex`, sets the number of hexagons horizontally across a tile.

parameters.name: squareSize
parameters.description: With `bin=square`, sets the size of the squares in pixels on a 4096px tile.  Choose a factor of 4096 so they tessalete correctly.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Sets the search mode.  `GEO_BOUNDS` is the default, and returns rectangles that bound all the occurrences in each bin.  `GEO_CENTROID` instead returns a point at the weighted centroid of the bin.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description:
Map tile format and resolution.
* `.mvt` for a vector tile
* `@Hx.png` for a 256px raster tile (for legacy clients)
* `@1x.png` for a 512px raster tile
* `@2x.png` for a 1024px raster tile
* `@3x.png` for a 2048px raster tile
* `@4x.png` for a 4096px raster tile
The larger raster tiles are intended for high resolution displays, i.e. 4k monitors and many mobile phones.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description:
Raster map style — only applies to raster (PNG) tiles.

Choose from one of the available styles, the default is `classic.point`.

Styles ending with `.point` should only be used by non-binned tiles.  Styles ending with `.poly` or `.marker.` should be used with hexagonal- or square-binned tiles.

See [map styles](#section/Map-styling).

parameters.name: basisOfRecord
parameters.description:
Basis of record, as defined in our BasisOfRecord vocabulary.

The parameter may be repeated to retrieve occurrences with any of the chosen bases of record.

items.description:
The values of the Darwin Core term Basis of Record which can apply to occurrences.

See GBIF's [Darwin Core Type Vocabulary](https://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/dwc/basis_of_record.xml) for definitions.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The 2-letter country code (as per ISO-3166-1) of the country in which the occurrence was recorded.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

parameters.name: taxonKey
parameters.description: A taxon key from the GBIF backbone.

parameters.name: datasetKey
parameters.description: The occurrence dataset key (a UUID).

parameters.name: publishingOrg
parameters.description: The publishing organization's GBIF key (a UUID).

parameters.name: publishingCountry
parameters.description: The 2-letter country code (as per ISO-3166-1) of the owning organization's country.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

parameters.name: networkKey
parameters.description: The network's GBIF key (a UUID).

parameters.name: year
parameters.description:
The 4 digit year or year range. A year of 98 will be interpreted as 98 AD.

Ranges are written as `1990,2000`, `1990,` or `,1900`.

minLat.description: The lowest latitude of occurrences covered by the query

maxLat.description: The highest latitude of occurrences covered by the query

minLng.description:
The lowest longitude of occurrences covered by the query.

For clusters of occurrences centered around the antimeridian (180° longitude) the `minLng` and `maxLng` will have a value just below 180° and above 180°.

maxLng.description:
The highest longitude of occurrences covered by the query.

For clusters of occurrences centered around the antimeridian (180° longitude) the `minLng` and `maxLng` will have a value just below 180° and above 180°.

minYear.description: The lowest year of occurrences covered by the query.

maxYear.description: The highest year of occurrences covered by the query.

total.description: The number of occurrences covered by the whole map.

generated.description: The time the map tile was generated.  Tiles are cached for hours to days, depending on the processing required to produce them.
